title: Adds certain school based health services to list of services which need not be provided by a managed care program
summary: Adds certain school based health services (i.e., services provided by certain clinics which provide primary health care services within an elementary or secondary public school setting) to the list of services which need not be provided by a managed care program but which shall be continued to be provided outside of managed care programs in accordance with applicable reimbursement methodologies.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1444

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 10, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. GOTTFRIED, PEOPLES-STOKES -- Multi-Sponsored by
         -- M. of A. CLARK, CYMBROWITZ, HOYT, LIFTON, MAGEE,  McENENY,  PAULIN,
         PHEFFER,  TOWNS  --  read once and referred to the Committee on Social
         Services

       AN ACT to amend the social services law,  in  relation  to  school-based
         health services under managed care programs

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subparagraphs (ix) and (x) of paragraph (e) of  subdivision
    2  3 of section 364-j of the social services law, as amended by chapter 648
    3  of the laws of 1999, are amended to read as follows:
    4    (ix) HIV COBRA case management; [and]
    5    (x) THE SERVICES PROVIDED ARE BY A CLINIC LICENSED UNDER ARTICLE TWEN-
    6  TY-EIGHT  OF  THE PUBLIC HEALTH LAW, OR SPONSORED BY A FACILITY LICENSED
    7  UNDER SUCH ARTICLE, WHICH  PROVIDES  PRIMARY  CARE  SERVICES  WITHIN  AN
    8  ELEMENTARY OR SECONDARY PUBLIC SCHOOL SETTING; AND
    9    (XI) other services as determined by the commissioner of health.
   10    S  2.  This  act shall take effect immediately provided, however, that
   11  the amendments to paragraph (e) of subdivision 3 of section 364-j of the
   12  social services law made by section one of this act shall not affect the
   13  repeal of such section and shall be deemed repealed therewith.




        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05343-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the social services law, in relation to school-based health services under managed care programs
